stepAnswer: excessive and irrational fear of a specific object, situation, or activity that is typically harmless; intense anxiety that can lead to avoidance behavior, severely impacting a person’s daily life and functioning
choices: excessive and irrational fear of a specific object, situation, or activity that is typically harmless; intense anxiety that can lead to avoidance behavior, severely impacting a person’s daily life and functioning

a sudden episode of intense fear or discomfort lasting several minutes or longer. During a panic attack, an individual may experience physical symptoms, such as sweating, trembling, heart palpitations, shortness of breath, and chest pain
